64
00:03:05.400 --> 00:03:07.840
Well, if I want to bring in points,

65
00:03:07.840 --> 00:03:10.400

66
00:03:10.400 --> 00:03:15.930
it might be awhile before I get back
down to the Caucus Race and a Long Tale.

67
00:03:15.930 --> 00:03:18.077
I wanna stay on that point for a while.

68
00:03:18.077 --> 00:03:21.868
Well, I don't want you reading it cuz
you're probably doing it right now as I'm

69
00:03:21.868 --> 00:03:24.572

this slide as I'm talking.

70
00:03:24.572 --> 00:03:28.336
You don't want to have them do that,
you want them to focus on you,

71
00:03:28.336 --> 00:03:30.630

72

I could have it zoom in or fly in or

73
00:03:34.427 --> 00:03:35.363
So let me show you how to do that.

74
00:03:35.363 --> 00:03:39.402
I'm on the slide, now, if you go over
to the Animations tab on your ribbon,

75
00:03:39.402 --> 00:03:41.946
you can see everything
is grayed out right now.

76
00:03:41.946 --> 00:03:44.578
The reason it's grayed out,
you don't have anything selected,

77
00:03:44.578 --> 00:03:46.750
it doesn't know what you want to animate.

78
00:03:46.750 --> 00:03:50.130
So, I have to is click somewhere

79
00:03:50.130 --> 00:03:53.410
Now, because I have these bulleted

80
00:03:53.410 --> 00:03:58.910

81

it's just gonna come in one by one.

82
00:04:01.950 --> 00:04:04.040
So I'm gonna do a basic one.

83
00:04:04.040 --> 00:04:06.729
Let's go in with a Fly and
you can see that's green,

84
00:04:06.729 --> 00:04:10.357
the reason why it's green is cuz
it's an entrance type of animation.

85
00:04:10.357 --> 00:04:13.080

object as opposed to our bullet points and
our bulleted list or our list slide.

533
00:27:52.490 --> 00:27:56.420
So, what you can do, though, is you need
to just go into your Effects Options, and

534
00:27:56.420 --> 00:28:02.890
see it's choosing all as one object,
okay, and all at once.

535
00:28:02.890 --> 00:28:04.490
That's not what I want, I want one by one.

536
00:28:04.490 --> 00:28:09.228
So that is an option within
the Effects Option to say now

537
00:28:09.228 --> 00:28:13.640
each piece within that
SmartArt is going to go.

538
00:28:13.640 --> 00:28:15.710
Cuz I'm around like why does
it keep picking it all at one?

539
00:28:15.710 --> 00:28:19.140
And I was like, I looked it up, and
it was like it's just the Effects Options.

540
00:28:19.140 --> 00:28:21.620
It's been there the whole time, really.

541
00:28:21.620 --> 00:28:23.540
So, I was pretty happy
to know how that goes.

542
00:28:23.540 --> 00:28:27.830
So, now I can say, this is our process,
this is our first step, talk, talk, talk.

543
00:28:27.830 --> 00:28:33.340
Second step, talk, talk, talk,
third step, and it can control SmartArt.

544
00:28:33.340 --> 00:28:38.160
SmartArt, that's hard to say
after these long episodes.

545
00:28:38.160 --> 00:28:41.510
So I think that's where we've
wrapped all of our animation.

546
00:28:41.510 --> 00:28:42.520
>> Fantastic Yvonne,

547
00:28:42.520 --> 00:28:45.830
great look at animation that
we can do within PowerPoint.

548
00:28:45.830 --> 00:28:51.131
From doing fly ins to doing multiple
animations, now I'm getting tongue tied.

549
00:28:51.131 --> 00:28:52.632
>> [LAUGH]
>> Tying them together,

550
00:28:52.632 --> 00:28:56.351
changing the timing, whether they do
automatically, whether you click on them.

551
00:28:56.351 --> 00:29:00.340
We looked at making custom paths,
adding sounds to our animations.

552
00:29:00.340 --> 00:29:04.750
And then how to even make the SmartArt
fly in or do different effects.

553
00:29:04.750 --> 00:29:05.480
So, we thank you for that,

554
00:29:05.480 --> 00:29:08.230
we hope everybody out there
enjoyed watching this one.

555
00:29:08.230 --> 00:29:11.250
Signing off for ITProTV,
I've been your host, Mike Rodrick.

556
00:29:11.250 --> 00:29:12.077
>> And I'm Vonne Smith.

557
00:29:12.077 --> 00:29:14.653
>> And we'll see you next time.

558
00:29:14.653 --> 00:29:20.705
[MUSIC]

559
00:29:20.705 --> 00:29:23.820
Thank you for watching ITProTV.

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike demonstrate working with slide transitions in PowerPoint. They add slide transitions to a single slide and to all slides. They look at the different effect options available for some slide transitions. They also show how to add sounds and modify the duration of slide transitions.
episodes.title: Slide Transitions
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.008 --> 00:00:02.689
Welcome to ITPRO.TV,
I'm your host, Don Pezet.

2
00:00:02.689 --> 00:00:06.057
[CROSSTALK]

3
00:00:06.057 --> 00:00:08.176
[MUSIC]

4
00:00:08.176 --> 00:00:12.085
>> You're watching ITPRO.TV.

5
00:00:12.085 --> 00:00:15.280
>> Hello, welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITPRO.TV.

6
00:00:15.280 --> 00:00:18.980
I'm your host Mike Rodrick and
today we're reviewing Powerpoint 2016.

7
00:00:18.980 --> 00:00:22.700
And specifically in this episode,
we're gonna be taking a look at Slide

8
00:00:22.700 --> 00:00:26.940
transitions, and here to help us with that
is Miss Vonne Smith, welcome back Vonne.

9
00:00:26.940 --> 00:00:30.005
>> Thank you, I'm ready to
transition into slide transitions.

10
00:00:30.005 --> 00:00:31.080
>> [LAUGH] You're so clever.

11
00:00:31.080 --> 00:00:34.820
>> Yes, I'm just rolling today
aren't I [LAUGH] all right,

12
00:00:34.820 --> 00:00:36.950
so what is a slide transition?

13
00:00:36.950 --> 00:00:42.110
It's exactly what it sounds like, it's how
slides transition from one to another,

14
00:00:42.110 --> 00:00:45.860
because by default it's just click,
click and it just pops right up.

15
00:00:45.860 --> 00:00:50.130
But if you wanted to like
have one fade into another or

16
00:00:50.130 --> 00:00:53.190
you want one to tumble out,
that would be a slide transition.

17
00:00:53.190 --> 00:00:57.337
It is considered animation and
you will get that little star on the side

18
00:00:57.337 --> 00:01:00.723
of the slide number in your slide pane or
your slides tab.

19
00:01:00.723 --> 00:01:03.716
But it is something to just be
aware of that it could be one or

20
00:01:03.716 --> 00:01:07.458
the other, either look for animation,
or look for a slide transition.

21
00:01:07.458 --> 00:01:12.244
So I have a file ready to go for
us with slide transition images, so

22
00:01:12.244 --> 00:01:15.998
I will open this up and
it's really just pictures.

23
00:01:15.998 --> 00:01:20.814
Okay, so I just have photographs
that are on a black background, and

24
00:01:20.814 --> 00:01:24.980
we have some scenery here,
this is Cartagena in Columbia.

25
00:01:24.980 --> 00:01:27.460
And you know where this, is don't you Tim?

26
00:01:27.460 --> 00:01:29.325
>> Yeah, that's DC area.

27
00:01:29.325 --> 00:01:33.196
>> No, no, [LAUGH] this is Tampa.

28
00:01:33.196 --> 00:01:34.684
>> [LAUGH] It's Tampa, yeah.

29
00:01:34.684 --> 00:01:36.100
>> Yeah, yeah, that's where it's at.

30
00:01:36.100 --> 00:01:37.656
>> [LAUGH]
>> And

31
00:01:37.656 --> 00:01:39.605
then we have some beach pictures, I think.

32
00:01:39.605 --> 00:01:42.672
St. Augustine and a couple other
coasts and then we have Chicago.

33
00:01:42.672 --> 00:01:43.267
>> Very nice.

34
00:01:43.267 --> 00:01:45.596
>> There we go, so
some different places that I have been to.

35
00:01:45.596 --> 00:01:48.184
So I wanted to go ahead and have my slide,

36
00:01:48.184 --> 00:01:51.640
use these pictures to do
our slide transitions demo.

37
00:01:51.640 --> 00:01:58.840
So I'm going to go to slide 1, and
how I want the slide show to start.

38
00:01:58.840 --> 00:02:01.560
Now do you want a slide
transition on the first slide?

39
00:02:01.560 --> 00:02:03.760
That really depends,

40
00:02:03.760 --> 00:02:08.390
because when you apply a transition to
a slide it's how that slide comes in.

41
00:02:08.390 --> 00:02:12.240
Well, that first slide is
usually one you already have up,

42
00:02:12.240 --> 00:02:13.770
like maybe when you
start the presentation.

43
00:02:13.770 --> 00:02:15.025
>> Like maybe the title
of your presentation.

44
00:02:15.025 --> 00:02:17.290
Almost like a cover sheet for
your report or something.

45
00:02:17.290 --> 00:02:20.110
>> Yes, exactly, so
that's one where you might not always

46
00:02:20.110 --> 00:02:22.860
want to have the transition
on that first slide.

47
00:02:22.860 --> 00:02:24.860
You can do it, but I'm gonna go ahead,

48
00:02:24.860 --> 00:02:28.699
I realized once I clicked on slide 1
I was like, no, let's go to slide 2.

49
00:02:28.699 --> 00:02:30.430
[LAUGH]
>> Vonne, and correctly if I'm wrong,

50
00:02:30.430 --> 00:02:31.486
let me make sure I understand.

51
00:02:31.486 --> 00:02:33.570
So when we talk about slide transitions,

52
00:02:33.570 --> 00:02:37.268
we're not talking about the content
on the slide, but the slide itself.

53
00:02:37.268 --> 00:02:41.803
>> Yes, but the movement, yes or
the animation between slides.

54
00:02:41.803 --> 00:02:42.404
>> Okay.

55
00:02:42.404 --> 00:02:45.150
>> So let's apply one and
then see how that works.

56
00:02:45.150 --> 00:02:50.130
So I'm going to go to the Transitions tab,
have my slide selected.

57
00:02:50.130 --> 00:02:53.590
Now what type of transition
would I like to choose?

58
00:02:53.590 --> 00:02:57.556
You have some subtle ones and
some a little bit more robust.

59
00:02:57.556 --> 00:02:58.485
>> Exciting.

60
00:02:58.485 --> 00:03:01.080
>> [LAUGH] Let's go with,

61
00:03:01.080 --> 00:03:05.620
I do like the morph one cuz then it just
kinda morphs one in on to the other.

62
00:03:05.620 --> 00:03:10.480
And you can see you have that preview
there of the slide that I was on before,

63
00:03:10.480 --> 00:03:11.000
slide 1.

64
00:03:11.000 --> 00:03:17.010
When slide 2 comes in it's going to morph
together, or maybe I wanted to do a wipe.

65
00:03:17.010 --> 00:03:21.500
You can see then it's going to wipe from
the slide before it to the next one, and

66
00:03:21.500 --> 00:03:22.380
so on, and so forth.

67
00:03:22.380 --> 00:03:26.560
I could do a peel off, ooh, that's fancy.

68
00:03:26.560 --> 00:03:27.940
>> That is exciting.

69
00:03:27.940 --> 00:03:28.991
>> Yes, [LAUGH] so

70
00:03:28.991 --> 00:03:34.788
you can apply the different ways that
this slide comes into the presentation.

71
00:03:34.788 --> 00:03:38.942
And that's really the easiest way to do
it, is just go ahead and go and apply it,

72
00:03:38.942 --> 00:03:41.498
but there of course are going
to be a few options.

73
00:03:41.498 --> 00:03:42.985
>> Can you do the airplane for us?

74
00:03:42.985 --> 00:03:44.370
>> [LAUGH]
>> I wanna see it.

75
00:03:44.370 --> 00:03:48.280
>> You wanna do the air,
okay [LAUGH] I will do that, there you go.

76
00:03:48.280 --> 00:03:49.830
And we fly away.

77
00:03:49.830 --> 00:03:51.161
>> Nice.
[LAUGH]

78
00:03:51.161 --> 00:03:53.930
>> [LAUGH] Perfect, so right here with

79
00:03:53.930 --> 00:03:58.295
this origami slide transition you
can look at the different effects.

80
00:03:58.295 --> 00:04:00.240
Cuz the bird took off to the right,

81
00:04:00.240 --> 00:04:03.630
what if I want it to fly out to the left,
you could go edit and do that.

82
00:04:03.630 --> 00:04:05.317
And of course depending
on which transition,

83
00:04:05.317 --> 00:04:06.495
[LAUGH] that one is really funny.

84
00:04:06.495 --> 00:04:08.480
>> [LAUGH]
>> It makes me laugh every time.

85
00:04:08.480 --> 00:04:09.310
>> It does.

86
00:04:09.310 --> 00:04:15.580
>> So if I was going to do the crush then
that's, you can notice that right there.

87
00:04:15.580 --> 00:04:18.280
Well, crush doesn't have
any effects options because

88
00:04:18.280 --> 00:04:22.225
there really isn't much more besides
crushing the slide to the next one.

89
00:04:22.225 --> 00:04:26.940
[LAUGH] So it depends on different
animation or transitions for

90
00:04:26.940 --> 00:04:28.320
different effects.

91
00:04:28.320 --> 00:04:31.830
Now, notice when I am applying
a transition by default it's

92
00:04:31.830 --> 00:04:34.480
only going to be applied
to that one slide.

93
00:04:34.480 --> 00:04:38.080
So if I wanted to I could
apply a different transition

94
00:04:38.080 --> 00:04:42.590
to slide 3 maybe I
wanted to do a prestige.

95
00:04:42.590 --> 00:04:46.910
I'm doing pretty dramatic ones so
you can really see them.

96
00:04:46.910 --> 00:04:50.986
So I could have a different
slide transition for each slide.

97
00:04:50.986 --> 00:04:56.267
Would that get obnoxious probably pretty
quickly, [LAUGH] so you want to one,

98
00:04:56.267 --> 00:05:01.562
use your slide transitions probably
sparingly depending on your audience.

99
00:05:01.562 --> 00:05:07.358
And then depend on, do you want to be
kind of over the top like we're doing,

100
00:05:07.358 --> 00:05:13.050
or do I want it to just maybe fade or
like a very simple like move up or down?

101
00:05:13.050 --> 00:05:16.330
Like the old school slides, remember
when you actually had to move up, yeah.

102
00:05:16.330 --> 00:05:18.400
>> Yes, uh-huh.
>> So, and then so

103
00:05:18.400 --> 00:05:21.280
you could apply to each one individually.

104
00:05:21.280 --> 00:05:24.930
But what if I wanted to,
if I have 60 slides and

105
00:05:24.930 --> 00:05:30.360
I'm doing like that subtle morphing or
just like a fade in?

106
00:05:30.360 --> 00:05:34.590
I don't want to have to click it 60 times,
I just wanna say apply to all.

107
00:05:34.590 --> 00:05:37.120
Well, there's that apply to all button.

108
00:05:37.120 --> 00:05:38.370
So I could say take this,

109
00:05:38.370 --> 00:05:43.030
I think we have our fracture on
slide 2 and we can apply it to all.

110
00:05:43.030 --> 00:05:47.640
And then you can see that it automatically
goes to each individual slide so

111
00:05:47.640 --> 00:05:51.665
that way when I run the show let's
just run it for a quick second.

112
00:05:51.665 --> 00:05:55.490
We'll start from the beginning, you can
see that we're now here in Colombia and

113
00:05:57.640 --> 00:06:01.080
I'm controlling the slide show just like
I would in any other slide show, but

114
00:06:01.080 --> 00:06:04.990
I have to click my mouse to go ahead and
advance to the next slide.

115
00:06:04.990 --> 00:06:09.610
Then I have to click, and so
each slide, each time it transitions to

116
00:06:09.610 --> 00:06:12.945
the next one is going to that fracture and
it's gonna all fall apart and fall down.

117
00:06:12.945 --> 00:06:16.735
>> Nice, all right now when we did
our animations in an earlier episode,

118
00:06:16.735 --> 00:06:20.295
we were able to tie some sounds
in with those animations.

119
00:06:20.295 --> 00:06:24.622
And I'm seeing this fractured slide and
in my head I keep hearing sounds.

120
00:06:24.622 --> 00:06:25.851
>> [LAUGH]
>> Can we do that with the slide

121
00:06:25.851 --> 00:06:26.927
transitions as well?

122
00:06:26.927 --> 00:06:31.454
>> You can [LAUGH] so if I go back
to slide t2, or I can go to slide 1,

123
00:06:31.454 --> 00:06:33.957
since I'm applying it to all.

124
00:06:33.957 --> 00:06:38.337
Gotta go back to that right tab,
over here you can see on the ribbon,

125
00:06:38.337 --> 00:06:41.337
that you can apply a sound.

126
00:06:41.337 --> 00:06:43.467
So we could go with,
I mean maybe there's a bomb.

127
00:06:44.550 --> 00:06:47.213
>> Yeah.
>> That sounds good, apply to all, so

128
00:06:47.213 --> 00:06:51.289
let's go ahead and
make sure that my speakers are not muted.

129
00:06:51.289 --> 00:06:55.667
I'll go from the beginning, so.

130
00:06:55.667 --> 00:06:56.209
The bomb is a little low, but.

131
00:06:56.209 --> 00:06:56.939
>> Very dramatic.

132
00:06:56.939 --> 00:07:00.463
[LAUGH]
>> Yes, but it is dramatic, [LAUGH] so

133
00:07:00.463 --> 00:07:06.502
you could add slide sounds to your,
wait, sounds to your slides.

134
00:07:06.502 --> 00:07:10.940
[LAUGH] In your transitions,
and you could apply to all.

135
00:07:10.940 --> 00:07:13.645
Now the other parts that
are on this ribbon.

136
00:07:13.645 --> 00:07:17.990
You have your duration and you have
your advance slide on mouse click, or

137
00:07:17.990 --> 00:07:20.565
you could have it advance automatically.

138
00:07:20.565 --> 00:07:25.508
Because this is a photo show and
maybe I wanted it to have this just

139
00:07:25.508 --> 00:07:31.140
going in the background as I'm
talking about traveling the world.

140
00:07:31.140 --> 00:07:34.584
I haven't really gone that many places but
[LAUGH] so, but

141
00:07:34.584 --> 00:07:36.676
if I had that and I just wanna talk.

142
00:07:36.676 --> 00:07:39.995
>> So, scenarios where the slides maybe
aren't directly related to what you're

143
00:07:39.995 --> 00:07:42.034
saying so
it doesn't matter which one it's on.

144
00:07:42.034 --> 00:07:45.248
>> Yes, exactly, and
there are other ways when we get into some

145
00:07:45.248 --> 00:07:48.730
other episodes where you want
to advance automatically.

146
00:07:48.730 --> 00:07:51.930
And you do have a script
that you wanna follow.

147
00:07:51.930 --> 00:07:56.050
So there are many different reasons why
you'd want the slide show to advance

148
00:07:56.050 --> 00:07:56.600
on your own.

149
00:07:56.600 --> 00:07:58.440
But yes I like the scenario
that you're saying.

150
00:07:58.440 --> 00:08:00.490
Let's go ahead and play it.

151
00:08:00.490 --> 00:08:02.020
So how do I do that?

152
00:08:02.020 --> 00:08:08.170
I can come over here to slide 1, I'm gonna
take the sound off just so, let's do that.

153
00:08:08.170 --> 00:08:13.270
The duration,
this matters only when you have the, well,

154
00:08:13.270 --> 00:08:15.400
actually, sorry, I messed up.

155
00:08:15.400 --> 00:08:18.810
The duration is the duration
of the transition, sorry.

156
00:08:18.810 --> 00:08:22.407
I was getting confused with the duration
of how long the slide was up.

157
00:08:22.407 --> 00:08:25.667
That's actually over here, so,
there's two clocks over there,

158
00:08:25.667 --> 00:08:27.564
duration of how long the effect takes.

159
00:08:27.564 --> 00:08:34.310
And then how long is it going to take the
slide to advance after so many seconds.

160
00:08:34.310 --> 00:08:36.390
>> Cuz you're not gonna be there to click
there or you're trying to set it up so

161
00:08:36.390 --> 00:08:39.450
you don't have to click so you got to
tell it when to move to the next one.

162
00:08:39.450 --> 00:08:40.180
>> Exactly, so

163
00:08:40.180 --> 00:08:44.990
if I wanted to say like after three
seconds I want the slide to advance.

164
00:08:44.990 --> 00:08:48.420
And so notice I took the,
on mouse click off, and

165
00:08:48.420 --> 00:08:53.340
then I turned on the check box
that I masked with the, sorry.

166
00:08:53.340 --> 00:09:00.480
I'm getting a little confused over here,
the check box is off the on mouse click.

167
00:09:00.480 --> 00:09:01.415
That's a mouthful.

168
00:09:01.415 --> 00:09:03.150
>> [LAUGH] That's confusing, yes.

169
00:09:03.150 --> 00:09:08.380
>> And I have checked on the after and
applied a certain amount of seconds.

170
00:09:08.380 --> 00:09:11.970
And I'm going to apply this to all,
and so let's go ahead and

171
00:09:11.970 --> 00:09:13.500
run this slide show from the beginning.

172
00:09:13.500 --> 00:09:15.610
So you could see it's going to do this.

173
00:09:15.610 --> 00:09:18.640
And if we were counting after
three seconds you could see

174
00:09:18.640 --> 00:09:23.400
that the slide is going to advance
to the next slide for three seconds.

175
00:09:23.400 --> 00:09:27.190
And so then I can talk about all
the different places, and the beach,

176
00:09:27.190 --> 00:09:31.320
and how I'd really like to go there very
soon because it's really nice weather

177
00:09:31.320 --> 00:09:32.730
right now, and the sun set is so pretty.

178
00:09:32.730 --> 00:09:38.190
So you can see that the slide is gonna
continue to go until the very end.

179
00:09:38.190 --> 00:09:40.960
And so I don't have to think
about clicking my mouse and

180
00:09:40.960 --> 00:09:44.030
controlling when the slide is
going to move to the next one.

181
00:09:44.030 --> 00:09:48.210
Now you can see that right now the show
has ended because that was my last slide.

182
00:09:48.210 --> 00:09:52.240
And I was hoping to talk enough
to have it get to the end.

183
00:09:52.240 --> 00:09:54.840
Because that's how I
setup the show to run.

184
00:09:54.840 --> 00:09:58.160
Now I feel like it's only
natural that if you're going to

185
00:09:58.160 --> 00:10:02.610
be doing these types of presentations,
maybe you want it to just loop back,

186
00:10:02.610 --> 00:10:06.990
want to continue because maybe you're
at a kiosk, or you're at a trade show.

187
00:10:06.990 --> 00:10:09.010
And you want that to just keep on moving,
and

188
00:10:09.010 --> 00:10:12.980
a lot of times that's what you would
do is have it transition automatically.

189
00:10:12.980 --> 00:10:17.910
So I wanted to just show you here on
this slide show tab that the setup,

190
00:10:17.910 --> 00:10:22.440
right there, Set Up slide show,
right now it's just set

191
00:10:22.440 --> 00:10:25.790
as your normal just presented by
the speaker and the speaker controls it.

192
00:10:25.790 --> 00:10:30.240
But if you choose the browse at kiosk
what that means is that it's going to

193
00:10:30.240 --> 00:10:35.240
automatically loop the slide

So you could see that it's

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike look at the final stages of creating a PowerPoint presentation. They go over using spell check and the thesaurus. They discuss printing options, hiding slides, adding headers and footers, and running your presentation. They also explore the different options available for sharing, exporting and saving a PowerPoint presentation.
episodes.title: Preparing a Presentation
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1

I wanted to go ahead and

>> I don't have any suggestions like okay

this isn't helping cuz I

>> It's necessary.

So, we go to, yes I'd like to go with

Now if I had misspelled design this way
